headline: An Oil Exec on ‘Landman,’ Venezuela, and Beating the S&P 500
summary: Mark Lashier, CEO of Phillips 66, also spoke about the energy company’s new directors and its relationship with the activist investor Elliott Management.  The Houston-based oil and gas company  Phillips 66  is named after the bygone era of early American automobiles that drove Route 66—and were fueled by Phillips Petroleum’s 66 octane gasoline.  Phillips Petroleum later merged into  ConocoPhillips  When ConocoPhillips split in two in 2012, Phillips 66 was created.

content.title: An Oil Exec on ‘Landman,’ Venezuela, and Beating the S&P 500

The Houston-based oil and gas company  Phillips 66  is named after the bygone era of early American automobiles that drove Route 66—and were fueled by Phillips Petroleum’s 66 octane gasoline.  Phillips Petroleum later merged into  ConocoPhillips  When ConocoPhillips split in two in 2012, Phillips 66 was created.

headline: Why Phillips 66 (PSX) Is Up 8.9% After Lindsey Refinery Deal And Refining Gains
summary: Phillips 66 recently agreed to acquire the Lindsey Oil Refinery assets in the U.K., aiming to integrate storage and infrastructure into its Humber Refinery to reinforce regional fuel supply and energy security while supporting hundreds of skilled jobs. At the same time, Phillips 66’s refining operations have seen stronger execution through higher utilization, improved reliability, and cost-efficiency measures, which together with the Lindsey integration plan could reshape how the company...
